page.description: Summarize the records of the table into a specified output table.
page.original:
&ltTBL>.SUMMARIZE() Syntax Specify the required values in the Sum dot variable, then use the following command: &ltTBL>.SUMMARIZE() VariableTypeDescription sum.dbCThe name of the resulting table. sum.orderCA character order expression that sorts selected records. sum.filterCA character filter expression that selects records to process. sum.optionsCOptions used when ordering the Result table records. This string can contain one or more of the following index codes: CodeDescription DThe Descending Order option puts the records in the Result table in descending alphabetical order or, for a numeric field, from highest to lowest value. UThe Unique option uses only unique records in the summary. sum.fieldsNIndicates how many fields are to be summarized. Each field to be included in the Summary operation is declared through a pair of parameters that indicate the field name and summary operator for that field. sum.field1 ... C sum.fieldN CFields (1 ... N) containing the names of the field(s) to be summarized. sum.code1 ... N sum.codeN NFields (1 ... N) containing the operation codes for the fields to be summarized. The following codes may be used: CodeOperationReturns SUM_OP_TOTAL (1)TotalThe sum of values for the specified field or expression. SUM_OP_COUNT (2)CountA count of the number of records included in the specified field or expression SUM_OP_MIN (3)MinThe minimum (smallest) value for the specified field or expression. SUM_OP_MAX (4)MaxThe maximum (largest) value for the specified field or expression. SUM_OP_AVERAGE (5)AverageThe average of values for the specified field or expression. SUM_OP_FIRST (6)FirstThe first value for the specified field or expression. SUM_OP_LAST (7)LastThe last value for the specified field or expression. NULL (15) Adds a column label in the output table for the specified field.
Description The &ltTBL>.SUMMARIZE() method is a high-level utility used to summarize the records of a specified table, creating a new table to store the result. Most parameters passed to &ltTBL>.SUMMARIZE()through the summary function variable correspond directly with the prompts appearing on the Summarize Builder which is accessed by defining a new summary operation from the Control Panel. Example This script counts the number of customers who live in each state. The result will be put in the specified output table. output_tbl = ui_get_file("Result Table","Tables(*.DBF)","","N") if output_tbl = "" then end end if tbl = table.current() sum.db = output_tbl sum.order = "STATE_PROV" sum.filter = "" sum.options = "I" sum.fields = 2 sum.field1 = "STATE_PROV" sum.code1 = 0 sum.field2 = "LAST_NAME" sum.code2 = 2 tbl.summarize()
See Also Table Functions and Methods, Table Operation Methods, Writing Expressions
